intro: Argyreia capitata var. conferta, commonly known as the red rattleplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, clustered red flowers that resemble rattles, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, contributing to its aesthetic appeal.
